verses.verse: Now the serpent <S%H5175><s%> was <S%H1961><s%> more subtle <S%H6175><s%> than any animal <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had made. <S%H6213><s%> He said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> "Has <S%H637><s%> God <S%H430><s%> really said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H398><s%> 'You shall not eat of any tree <S%H6086><s%> of the garden? <S%H1588><s%>'"
The woman <S%H802><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the serpent, <S%H5175><s%> "Of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> we may eat, <S%H398><s%>

but of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> which is in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the garden, <S%H1588><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H398><s%> 'You shall not eat of it, <S%H5060><s%> neither shall you touch it, <S%H6435><s%> lest you die. <S%H4191><s%>'"
The serpent <S%H5175><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> "You won't <S%H4191><s%> surely die, <S%H4191><s%>

for God <S%H430><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> that in the day <S%H3117><s%> you eat <S%H398><s%> it, <S%H5869><s%> your eyes will be opened, <S%H6491><s%> and you will be like God, <S%H430><s%> knowing <S%H3045><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> and evil. <S%H7451><s%>"

When the woman <S%H802><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that the tree <S%H6086><s%> was good <S%H2896><s%> for food, <S%H3978><s%> and that it <S%H1931><s%> was a delight <S%H8378><s%> to the eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and that the tree <S%H6086><s%> was to be desired <S%H2530><s%> to make one wise, <S%H7919><s%> she took <S%H3947><s%> of its <S%H6529><s%> fruit, <S%H398><s%> and ate; and she gave <S%H5414><s%> some <S%H1571><s%> to her husband <S%H376><s%> with her, <S%H398><s%> and he ate.

The eyes <S%H5869><s%> of both <S%H8147><s%> of them were opened, <S%H6491><s%> and they <S%H1992><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that they were naked. <S%H5903><s%> They sewed <S%H8609><s%> fig <S%H8384><s%> leaves <S%H5929><s%> together, <S%H8609><s%> and made themselves <S%H6213><s%> aprons. <S%H2290><s%>

They heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in the garden <S%H1588><s%> in the cool <S%H7307><s%> of the day, <S%H3117><s%> and the man <S%H120><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> hid themselves <S%H2244><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> among the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden. <S%H1588><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> to the man, <S%H120><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H335><s%> "Where are you?"

The man said, <S%H559><s%> "I heard <S%H8085><s%> your voice <S%H6963><s%> in the garden, <S%H1588><s%> and I was afraid, <S%H3372><s%> because I <S%H595><s%> was naked; <S%H5903><s%> and I hid myself. <S%H2244><s%>"

God said, <S%H559><s%> "Who told <S%H5046><s%> you that you were naked? <S%H5903><s%> Have you eaten <S%H398><s%> from the tree <S%H6086><s%> that I commanded you not <S%H1115><s%> to eat from? <S%H398><s%>"

The man <S%H120><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "The woman <S%H802><s%> whom you gave <S%H5414><s%> to be with me, <S%H5978><s%> she <S%H1931><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> me <S%H398><s%> of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> and I ate."

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> "What is this you have done? <S%H6213><s%>" The woman <S%H802><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "The serpent <S%H5175><s%> deceived me, <S%H5377><s%> and I ate. <S%H398><s%>"

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the serpent, <S%H5175><s%> "Because you <S%H859><s%> have done <S%H6213><s%> this, <S%H779><s%> you are cursed above all livestock, <S%H929><s%> and above every animal <S%H2416><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%> On your belly <S%H1512><s%> you shall go, <S%H3212><s%> and you shall eat <S%H398><s%> dust all the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life. <S%H2416><s%>

I will put <S%H7896><s%> enmity <S%H342><s%> between you and the woman, <S%H802><s%> and between your offspring <S%H2233><s%> and her offspring. <S%H2233><s%> He will bruise <S%H7779><s%> your head, <S%H7218><s%> and you will bruise <S%H7779><s%> his heel. <S%H6119><s%>"

To the woman <S%H802><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> "I will greatly <S%H7235><s%> multiply <S%H7235><s%> your pain in childbirth. <S%H2032><s%> In pain <S%H6089><s%> you will bear <S%H3205><s%> children. <S%H1121><s%> Your desire <S%H8669><s%> will be for your husband, <S%H376><s%> and he will rule over you. <S%H4910><s%>"

To Adam <S%H121><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> "Because you have listened <S%H8085><s%> to your wife <S%H802><s%>'s voice, <S%H6963><s%> and have eaten <S%H398><s%> of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> I commanded you, <S%H6680><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> <S%H398><s%> 'You shall not eat of it, <S%H779><s%>' cursed is the ground <S%H127><s%> for your sake. <S%H6093><s%> In toil you will eat <S%H398><s%> of it all <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life. <S%H2416><s%>
It will yield <S%H6779><s%> thorns <S%H6975><s%> and thistles <S%H1863><s%> to you; <S%H398><s%> and you will eat the herb <S%H6212><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

By the sweat <S%H2188><s%> of your face <S%H639><s%> will you eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> until you return <S%H7725><s%> to the ground, <S%H127><s%> for out of it you were taken. <S%H3947><s%> For you are dust, <S%H6083><s%> and to dust you shall return. <S%H7725><s%>"
The man <S%H120><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> his <S%H802><s%> wife <S%H8034><s%> Eve, <S%H2332><s%> because she was the mother <S%H517><s%> of all living. <S%H2416><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> coats <S%H3801><s%> of skins <S%H5785><s%> for Adam <S%H120><s%> and for his wife, <S%H802><s%> and clothed them. <S%H3847><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H2005><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> has become like one <S%H259><s%> of us, <S%H3045><s%> knowing good <S%H2896><s%> and evil. <S%H7451><s%> Now, <S%H7971><s%> lest he reach out his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and also take <S%H3947><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life, <S%H2416><s%> and eat, <S%H398><s%> and live <S%H2425><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>.."

Therefore Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> sent him out from <S%H7971><s%> the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden, <S%H5731><s%> to till <S%H5647><s%> the ground <S%H127><s%> from which he was taken. <S%H3947><s%>

So he drove out <S%H1644><s%> the man; <S%H120><s%> and he placed <S%H7931><s%> Cherubs <S%H5731><s%> at the east <S%H6924><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden, <S%H5731><s%> and the flame <S%H3858><s%> of a sword <S%H2719><s%> which turned every way, <S%H2015><s%> to guard <S%H8104><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> to the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%>
